intro: Psychotria rhytidocarpa, commonly known as the scarlet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, black seeds. Psychotria rhytidocarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
